content: I run a POP3 account but I was under the impression that, unless the folders trying to be created with in the Local Folders, they are best created in the online account of your Email provider - which then mirrors them on the IMAP TB section. Have you tried this?
creator: frisée

content: Ideas and suggestions can be loaded here - https://connect.mozilla.org/t5/ideas/idb-p/ideas As an aside, recovering an error is built into the Windows OS and is accessed by using the keyboard command Ctrl+Z
creator: frisée

content: You can make Local Folders in Thunderbird and copy the messages that you want to save into those folders for safe keeping. I don't know what you mean by 'Thunderbird server' - TB is not an Email provider and does not have a server. It is also good housekeeping to back up your Profile at least once a week to safeguard against data loss.
creator: frisée

content:
Please explain a bit further as to what you mean by 'removing a lost password'. It seems from your post that you are referring to an email on an Email account but I don't know why that would need to be 'removed'.

Please also include a screenshot of any errors that you have received to help us understand the problem.

There is only one question that you have submitted here so no one has suggested any action for you to take.
creator: frisée
